review.itemreviewed: 32oz Wide Mouth Water Bottle + Chug Cap
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchase this bottle last year for my high school athlete son . He likes that the month of the bottle is not to big to spill all over but wide enought to chug. It is good size too to last few hours. I like that it is easy to clean. For this year, I customized them (very easy process) for my nieces in same age group for Christmas. One of them opened it over the weekend for early Chsritmas present -- she loves the customized etching design with her name to personalize. Perfect gift idea since everyone needs to drink somthing. !
review.name: a repeat purchase!

review.itemreviewed: 32oz Wide Mouth Water Bottle + Chug Cap
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Flex Chug Cap is extremely difficult to remove from the bottle, because it has no strap attached to it to use as leverage.
review.name: Cute bottle, terrible cap.

review.itemreviewed: 32oz Wide Mouth Water Bottle + Chug Cap
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am surprised my mug can keep either hot or cold for days!
review.name: Keeping temperatures

review.itemreviewed: 32oz Wide Mouth Water Bottle + Chug Cap
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are the best water bottles. Will purchase all colors! Please offer matching straw lids!!
review.name: Favorite water bottle

review.itemreviewed: 32oz Wide Mouth Water Bottle + Chug Cap
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great new chug cap, easy to get to during workouts
review.name: Love new cap

review.itemreviewed: 32oz Wide Mouth Water Bottle + Chug Cap
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I had this bottle for just a few days and accidentally dropped it. It didn’t fall that far or hard but it got a dent. Disappointing that it’s not more durable.
review.name: Lacks Durability

review.itemreviewed: 32oz Wide Mouth Water Bottle + Chug Cap
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] All the features I wanted plus low cost personalized inscription. Finally a water bottle worth the investment.
review.name: Just what I wanted.

review.itemreviewed: 32oz Wide Mouth Water Bottle + Chug Cap
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this bottle, keeps water tasting fresh (unlike my previous bpa-free plastic ones). The chug cap is great, nice flow of water but no opportunity to pour too much like a normal wide mouth, and no having to pull hard on a straw cap. Love the chug cap! One thing though - it doesn’t fit in my car cup holders - bottom is too wide. Only thing that will keep me from buying this size again. But overall - love it!
review.name: Chug Cap for the WIN!

review.itemreviewed: 32oz Wide Mouth Water Bottle + Chug Cap
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Loved the new color. Engraving is very nice. Great Christmas gift.
review.name: 32 oz

review.itemreviewed: 32oz Wide Mouth Water Bottle + Chug Cap
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased the the 32 oz Wide Mouth with Flex Chug Cap two weeks ago and am enjoying it. Perfect size for me as I carry it around and do not place it in a backpack. I feel, it might be too big if you’re also carrying your laptop, a keyboard, mouse, and headphones in your backpack. Also doesn’t fit in a regular cupholder (tested in Mazda MX-30).
review.name: The right size for me :)

name: 32oz Wide Mouth Water Bottle + Chug Cap

review.reviewBody: Perfect Jacket if you want to stay dry and like a shell you can layer underneath on cold days. You get a lot for your money, does everything the more expensive jacket offer. Highly recommend. True to size.
review.name: Flylow Knight Jacket

review.reviewBody: Purchase this as an outer shell for warmer days and better rain protection. It is a great jacket for that purpose and it fits well look sharp. It has armpit vents and a chest pocket in addition to two front pockets. But it does not have a pocket in the sleeve for a ski pass. It's not insulated so obviously it's not the best option on a cold day. It did not have as much wind protection as I thought it would have, but I bought it for a lighter weight jacket because I skied so many 40° days last year. Overall this is a great looking shell with all the features I was looking for except for a sleeve pocket for a ski pass
review.name: Great fit and function, not for cold day

review.reviewBody: I sized down to a medium and the upper 3/4 fits perfect. The bottom of the jacket is very narrow and so long, that its like skiing in a tight mini skirt. Great material and solid seams, but the fit makes it unusable.
review.name: very odd fit

review.reviewBody:
Loved the jacket, but it didn't fit.  I'm 5' 6" and 145 lbs.  The size small was a little too big, even with a big puffer underneath and definitely too long.

FYI, The Vista looks very yellow online, but in reality it's got some green to it. Kind of tennis ball yellow.
review.name: Nice shell, but didn't fit

review.reviewBody: The jacket seems nice, but unfortunately it will be returned due to poor sizing.  I originally had a Flylow Roswell in a large.  It fit perfectly.  I figured this would work.  Unfortunately this jacket is too big and too long.  So much so that I had to do a double take to ensure I didn't accidentally receive an XL.
review.name: Large and Long

review.reviewBody: After extensive research and review of this genre (taped ski shell), I settled on the FlyLow Knight jacket in Vista and was not disappointed! As a ski guide, I look for quality and function at a great price (hey, we don't do this for the money...) and this jacket was 5 stars. All taped seams and zippers were impervious to the wind and moisture and the powder waistband keeps wind out as well. Pockets were properly located and oriented for ease of use and the hood fit nicely over my helmet. The sizing was perfect for layering, even in the arm spaces. Very happy with my purchase and would recommend this jacket to others that are looking in that product genre.
review.name: Excellent Quality and Function

review.reviewBody: 3 layer shell for $300 bucks? you betcha.
review.name: 2020 Knight video

name: Knight Jacket - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Alltrack Pro 120LT MV GW Ski Boot - 2025 - Men's
review.reviewBody:
These work great when I'm skinning up, but, more importantly, they give me the precision and control I need on groomers and in the woods.  And, as a bonus, the thinsulate liners makes them the warmest boots I've owned -- I haven't even needed to put in my Hotronic foot beds because the liners are so good.  I use the medium volume 120s which give me a lot of control at speed, and fit better than my 98 last race boots.

And, these work just as well in my regular, Pivot DIN bindings as my uphill, pin-bindings
review.name: Great Alpine touring boots that I use mostly for downhill

name: Alltrack Pro 120LT MV GW Ski Boot - 2025 - Men's

review.reviewBody: We are very happy with the MSR Revos (my husband and I both bought a pair). We had never snowshoed and found them easy to get on and off as well as walk in them. review.reviewBody: Fits snugly on my head and my helmet fits over without feeling as if my head is in a vice. Kept my head warm in 40-50 F weather...would recommend this piece of kit..thnks
review.name: gorewear windstop helmet cap

review.reviewBody:
The material feels kind of clammy and disgusting, not something you want on your head.

Pretty much holds no heat, just blocks the wind where there's wind blocker.

Well made, good fit, good coverage but I won't be buying more GORE that would touch my skin.
review.name: Gross feel. Not warm.

review.reviewBody: Good ear coverage. The part around the forehead, ears, and neck is windbreaking material. The part on top of the head is more breathable. The whole thing keeps the head from getting cold, and it’s also not made me feel hot. I’ve used this in 40 to 50 degree temps and felt great.
review.name: Great in 40-50 degree weather

review.reviewBody: Runs big. I wear a 7 and 5/8 fitted ball cap, and wear a large helmet. Also have a decent amount of hair. The large fit loose on my head even with all that said, keeps the head warm. The fit sticks out the front of the helmet and over the hairline/top of forehead. When riding hard I found it almost too warm unless the temp was in the low 30s or below.
review.name: Keeps the head warm

review.reviewBody:
I purchased Gore's helmet cap and also their thermal beanie for comparison. The fit of the helmet cap was much better for me, with respect to the ear coverage -- the helmet cap covered my ears very well, while the thermal beanie just barely covered them. I returned the thermal beanie because I am sure my ear lobes would have become uncovered pretty quickly once riding!

I wore the helmet cap out on a 45-degree day and my ears and head were nice and warm, and the fit felt great.

The Cons of the helmet cap: (1) I wish it had slits for glasses like the thermal beanie. (2) The fabric near the ears is noticeably louder in the helmet cap vs. the thermal beanie. It rustles quite a bit...but once I was out riding I didn't notice it. (3) I had a line across my forehead for the rest of the day, there's some serious elastic holding it in place! But I think this is the cases with most caps like this.
review.name: Overall good!
comment:
A quick comment on the size...I bought a Large, expecting it to run smaller than sized (which is typical of every other Gore item my wife or I have).  But it actually runs a truer to size. For reference, the circumference of my head is 23 inches (just above the eybrows, where this cap sits) and the Large fits well.

It appears that the crown is not wind-proof; only the part around the forehead and ears have the typical Gore wind block feel. I haven't used it yet, but I fully expect it to perform as expected.

name: C3 GORE Windstopper Helmet Cap

review.reviewBody: Does not nest with the alpine pot set as advertised
review.name: Does not nest with the

review.reviewBody: Great quality gear, handle works better than other gear I’ve used in the past. Avoid using metal cooking instruments to avoid wear and tear. Handle locks into place perfectly and does not wiggle or fault in any way. Perfect for cooking for 1-2 people
review.name: Amazing system

review.reviewBody: This stove is very fragile, the coating wears out too quickly. Considering the price, I am very disappointed with this product which must be changed very often. Only suitable for occasional use. I contacted the after-sales service in France: for MSR it's normal, not made to last over time.
review.name: Good size, light, but very rapid wear

review.reviewBody:
Ive had 2 of these for about 2+ years, and have about 30 or 40 nights of use so far. 

Cons: The plastic handle clip melted on my camp stove over medium level heat, so now I can't collapse the handle. It's mostly used for truck camping, so not a big deal for me.

Pros: The non-stick is great, anything else I've cooked, be it eggs, chicken, saut°ed veggies, have all come out awesome, and easy clean up, which is great when cleaning up camp. 

TL;DR I'd buy again in a heartbeat,  buuuuut hopefully the plastic lock becomes a piece of metal one day so it won't melt on medium-high heat.
review.name: Great for eggs. Not so great for bacon

review.reviewBody: Good length for a 2 liter or larger pot. Not good for the non stick pots though.
review.name: Good product, don't think I need another one.

review.reviewBody: Haven't used yet but light and small. Intend to use for trout in backcountry.
review.name: Yes

review.reviewBody: Honestly put this thing through the wringer for 5 days and it held up. Cooked multiple meals over a fire with this skillet and it held up. Took care not to get the plastic pieces too hot as they looked like they could melt. Easy to clean and stored nicely in my pack. The handle comes off in my pack now, but I think that was my fault for how I packed it. I can reattach it no problem and it is still usable, I just have a handle getting to the bottom of my pack now.
review.name: Tough little skillet

review.reviewBody: I bought this skillet for backpacking trips when I want to cook a small trout stream side or make bacon and eggs for breakfast. I can't wait for the weather to improve so I can give it a test run. The non-stick coating and light weight and packability are just what I was looking for. I will most likely purchase the Alpinist 2 Cook Set to nest with this skillet so I have a complete system for two.
review.name: Perfect for cooking trout at stream side

review.reviewBody: MSR makes high quality skillets, but I prefer, and continue to use for the last 6 years, the previous model with sloping sides, which makes it easier to slide in a small spatula to flip pan cakes or eggs. If this current model were the only style available, I would still buy it, and just have to learn to make smaller pancakes.
review.name: MSR skillets

review.reviewBody: Wanted a frying pan that nested with my Quik 2 cookset, and this is it. G The entire set is great for car camping, and it can be split for bacpacking. Love the pan, great for frying eggs for breakfast.
review.name: Great low weight frying pan

name: Quick Skillet

description: Buy the Rock N Roll Extreme Lube online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Extreme Lube
hasVariant.description: Buy the Rock N Roll Extreme Lube online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Mostly dry dusty conditions here. I have been using Rock N Roll Extreme (blue) for years now.  Keeps the chain clean, good for several dry rides before needing to reapply. You can reapply and wipe excess of chain which cleans the chain quite a few times before really needing to get in and wash your drive train.

Colorado also dumps heavy rain at times. I have used this in very wet conditions and rain. Not sure if anything really works well with wet grit, sand and mud on the chain. The only thing I can say is once you get home it is really easy to wash and clean your drive train and chain when Rock N Roll was used in comparison to using a super wet condition chain formula which is usually sticky, greasy, waxy and hard to clean off.

Some of my friends have moved on to using another type of chain cleaner lubricant. They say it is better, but I didn't have the time to investigate and bought into a 16oz bottle of Rock N Roll. This is good stuff and will be using it for as long as that bottle lasts which could be a couple years more.
review.name: Good for Colorado Mountain Biking

name: Extreme Lube

review.reviewBody: I misjudged the size for this hoodie and had to return it.  One phone call and I had a had a return FEDEX label e-mailed to me.  Within 4 days my return was processed, and I received the proper sized hoodie.  Very happy that this worked out so well, thanks.
review.name: Great customer service

review.reviewBody: This hooded sweatshirt is very thick and comfortable. It feels very sturdy and I think it will last a long time. XL is perfect for me at 6'0/200lb, roomy but not too baggy.
review.name: High quality sweatshirt

review.reviewBody: I am embarrassed to say that, after receiving this Hoodie, I wore it constantly for several days; including literally sleeping in it.  It's THAT nice!  The material is heavy and substantial; rugged on the outside, cushy and fleecy on the inside. Truth be told, I got the same Hoodie in two sizes: An XL to wear with maybe a T-shirt underneath and an XXL in case I wanted a layer underneath.  Sizing is "Unisex", so if you a man on the cusp, consider sizing UP; if you are a woman on the cusp, consider sizing DOWN.  The logo on the front makes a statement.  You may attract compliments and/or "where did you get it?" questions.  This is nothing more and nothing LESS than the best Hoodie out there.  Typical Patagonia quality for you!
review.name: Best Hoodie Out There!

name: P-6 Logo Uprisal Hoodie

review.reviewBody: I am currently carrying a total of 9 cards and a handful of coins in this little wallet. I do believe i could fit more. There's a slightly strange smell, almost kind of minty, that's been there since I took the wallet out of the package. I'm not sure what it is and it's not terrible but thought it's worth mentioning. I definitely recommend this wallet to anyone looking to downsize or carry minimal.

review.reviewBody: An excellent card holder…I keep it in my Kanken Sling bag which I am CRAZY about….super rugged and both pieces solve carry problems for me….I’m a believer.  :)

review.reviewBody: This is a cute, small and very well made card holder.  However I didn’t order my frost green one to use as cards.   I am using it to keep various medications in!  It holds a mini eye drop container, some pills in a blister pack and a few small travel containers I put loose medications in.  It’s fantastic looking and makes a nice attractive way to carry prescription medications!

review.reviewBody: This wallet is awesome if you're looking for something small that can carry your wallet essentials! There are 2 card slots that could each fit 2-4 cards, a zipping coin pouch and a outer pocket. This wallet is exactly what I was looking for!

review.reviewBody: have owned them for over a year and have held up great with indoor climbing multiple times a week. Got them resoled then turned them into outdoor bouldering shoes and they're incredible. Only issue is that the white strap is starting to fray but it's still holding strong otherwise. Overall, great shoe for experienced climbers who fancy standing on sharp edges. Just don't do much smearing in them
These shoes use US sizing and it's not super clear they size in women's. I accidentally just assumed for some reason and have to order another pair. I'll edit my review once I try them.
review.name: Haven't used the shoes yet, seem good, but heads up

review.reviewBody:
After years with the Shaman and Oracle, I have 100% switched to these. I also had the regular version of the Phantom, but it was too high volume for my C-width size 10 feet. I down-sized to compensate, but this made the shoes too painful to use very often. This low-volume version in a larger size is very close to perfect for me.

Additionally, this is the only shoe I've found that puts the big toe in a straight, powerful position. A year ago I sprained my ankle while trying to run in some high-heeled, narrow approach shoes that pushed my big toe inward, like most shoes do. The damage was around my navicular bone in my arch. During my rehab, I've learned how much more powerful your arch and overall foot are when the big toe is NOT pushed inward. Take a look at the toe area vs the Shaman and you will see the design difference around the big toe. 

Evolv, thank you so much for making this low volume shoe is big enough sizes to fit this narrow-footed man. My messed-up left big toe does miss the Shaman's love bump a bit though.
review.name: Straight Big Toe Position is Unique and Wonderful

review.reviewBody: This shoe is my go to for both hard outdoor climbing and competitions. It fits like a glove fresh out the box, has excellent edging power and a snug heel. Brand new, this shoe is plenty stiff for steep climbing on small footholds; once it's thoroughly broken in, it becomes flexible and sensitive enough for low angle slab smearing. I keep several pairs broken in to different levels of stiffness for various applications. It's also shockingly comfortable. If you're trying to climb hard and you only have one pair of shoes, this should be it.
review.name: Best all-around performance shoe in the game

review.reviewBody: I really, really like the Phantom (non-LV), but wished there was just a little "less" to them, thus, I LOVE the Phantom LV. On day one I thought I'd wear them on my warm-up to start breaking them in and ending up wearing them for the entire day, including on my project. These are the most comfortable aggressive shoes I've ever worn, and I don't feel like I'm sacrificing a thing in exchange!
review.name: Psyched

review.reviewBody: Excellent fit for low volume feet. Perform well right out of the box with very little break in time required. Super durable construction with just the right amount of sticky Trax SAS rubber for long wear time. Semi-soft yet super supportive for toeing hard on knee bars and steep pockets. Phantoms heel hook like a dream! This is now my favorite climbing shoe for steep climbing... EVER!!!
review.name: Excels on the Steep!

name: Phantom LV Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody: This pack needs to be just a little bit longer and wider. The next size up, which I think is the Full Moon probably would have worked better for me overall but I think a size in between these two models would be the perfect EDC. If you are the fence on size go with the Full Moon. With this model a wallet, keys and phone it is completely maxed out.
review.name: A tad smaller than I thought it would be

review.reviewBody: My mom says I look like a bag of dollar store rainbow bendy straws
review.name: Miami yellers fancy pack

review.reviewBody:
Bought this hold a camera while on adventures. Fits perfect. 
Have a bunch of Mystery Ranch stuff and the build quality is great as always.
review.name: Great little fanny pack.

review.reviewBody: I have been using this pack about 2wks now and really appreciate the capacity and design of it. Fits perfectly (waist) stays in place and comfortable, buckle design, and attachment to the pack is excellent, the pack stays in place.
review.name: Plenty of room

review.reviewBody: I have been using the Patagonia blackhole hip pack and wanted something with just a bit more room. Boom, in comes MR with a bag with just a bit more space. The bumbag is solid quality and feels nice when wearing. The only ding I have is the zippered secure pocket on the inside is very hard to access while wearing the bag. I also wish the external pocket had a zipper vice a button for more security. Otherwise, this is a great bumbag that is offered in a multitude of colors to suit your style.
review.name: Great little bumbag

review.reviewBody: Fits what you need and looks stylish. Perfect size
review.name: Perfect pack

review.reviewBody: I’ve got 2 of these, one mini for my daughter in peat, and the normal size, for me, in black. The mini has been around her waist for over a year literally every day. She loves it and it has held up well. The black one is the normal, classic 330 Robic material, which I like. It reminds me of a tighter 500d Cordura, and only a tad softer. I wear mine across the body when I travel internationally, and while in-country with all the essentials, so that I’m not carrying a backpack. In it, I’ll carry an extra phone (iPhone +), usually in the snap pocket, and on the inside I have a battery bank, cords, passport, rental car keys, air pods, and a pen. When I sit down on a plane, I can still put my wallet in it. Overall it’s very handy and just what I needed without looking like a purse.
review.name: Well made and super handy

review.reviewBody: Exactly as described, and exactly what I was looking for…thank you MR!
review.name: This thing is the bomb

review.reviewBody: I'm a gal and I hate carrying a purse.  My pockets don't always have enough room for my phone, wallet and keys...and I wear prescription sun glasses/glasses so I need somewhere to stash those as I move around from the inside to the outside.  Its durable, fits nice, I can wear it around my hips or I can wear it as a sling across my chest.  Great pack for the minimalist that needs just enough space for a few items.
review.name: Perfect size for phone, wallet, keys, and glasses

review.reviewBody: After a lot of searching, found the perfect EDC for my husband. It was a gift and he is super happy with it.
review.name: Great gift

name: Forager 2.5L Hip Pack

review.reviewBody: You all Mountain House geniuses made a great meal!  I will add this meal to my ⚙️pantry⚙️ forever!  Please would you kindly consider adding steak with loaded potatoes, cheese Burger , hot dog, and Chinese meals like Egg Foo Young and pot stickers.   Thank you!
review.name: ⚙️Chinese Cuisine Oooh lala⚙️

review.reviewBody: This Kung Pow Chicken was wonderful. Too spicy for my wife's palate, however I found it lightly spicy while delicious. Not what you might have expected from a emergency meal.
review.name: Kung pow more like Kung Wow!

review.reviewBody: It was great and I shared it with friends who thought so also.
review.name: Great food and great service from Mountain House

review.reviewBody: These are great. Shipping was fast. I will order again.
review.name: Kung pow Chickern

review.reviewBody: My order was delivered on the 10th of February. The kung pao chicken was very tasty. I wish I had bought more.
review.name: Kung Pao Chicken

review.reviewBody: Very good.  A tiny bit less spicy and it would be better.  Lots of different flavors in each bite makes it interesting.
review.name: bet

review.reviewBody: Not a family who likes hot and spicey so will not be re-ordering Kung Pao Chicken.
review.name: If you like heat, you will enjoy this meal.

review.reviewBody: I received two pouches of Kung Pao Chicken by mistake and Mountain House let me keep them to try.  Like the Yellow Curry and Pad Thai Chicken this is another Asian hit.  It does have a nice spice kick but not overwhelming, maybe a 3 out of 10.  I used 1 and a third cups of water and it came out great.  Rice completely cooked and chicken nice and tender.  The cook time is longer on this meal but worth the wait.  I will definitely order this in future.
review.name: Mountain House does Asian well.

review.reviewBody: I just bought this and was at the house in less than a week so kudos on the turnaround. Flavor was phenomenal and a very satisfying meal.
review.name: Repeat customer

name: Kung Pao Chicken

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It's delightfully lightweight, so easy to put on, and flattering (I have wide hips and big behind and it's hard to find a good fit). Windproof (it is *very* windy year round where I live) and perfect for unpredictable spring temps. I wore it for an hour under pouring rain and I didn't even feel the coolness of the raindrops. I know it's not supposed to be a rain jacket, but I'm glad I got to test it out under those conditions. Fits true to size. I love this color way as well (Peach and vetiver).
review.name: Perfect for unpredictable late winter to spring

description: Buy the Sea To Summit Detour Stainless Steel 10in Pan online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Detour Stainless Steel 10in Pan
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Detour Stainless Steel 10in Pan online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: If you're looking for a solid pan for car camping, this is it! The detachable handle is helpful when trying to save space. The pan is large enough for small family meals. It is strong and durable. I feel confident that I'll get years of use out of this one!
review.name: Quality & Durability

review.reviewBody:
High quality pan for being so travel friendly. Feels sturdy enough to last at least my lifetime while still feeling feather light compared to my home stainless behemoths. I have a large Camp Chef Everest 2X stove and this thing heated up instantly and evenly cooking 4 bacon strips without having to rotate them. Enough room to make a decent 1 pot meal for 2 or a great side saute for a small crew. Interested in the 5L pot/colander set that can nest inside, would have liked to have had that for my camper roadtrip last summer, seems like it would be the ultimate quality cookset you could easily fit in a shallow drawer
The play/wobble in the handle latch did feel a little worrisome before testing about how it would feel loaded but proved sturdy and planted when holding the weight of the pan and stayed cool throughout. All in all love the new click in system
review.name: Mobile Gourmet

name: Detour Stainless Steel 10in Pan

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket about a month ago.  I live in WI and we get a lot of cold and windy and wet winter weather.  I have a Helly Hansen 3 in 1 winter jacket for the super cold days (minus 20 or less windchill) but it's big and bulky.  I wanted something with similar warmth but without the bulk.  This jacket checks all the boxes.  Pricy but worth it.  Great warmth, not bulky, looks good.
review.name: lightweight and warm

review.reviewBody: Just ok, had higher expectations. Very warm and light weight. Hood is huge and sloppy, must be tightened down a lot to stay clear of your vision. Pockets are not lined but are positioned well for hands and glove storage. No real features integrated for the price, just seems very plain Jane. Example, it doesn't pack into itself and has no external chest pocket. Pit zippers are massive but I don’t intend to ever use them. Exterior fabric “PERTEX” seems like it will perform very well in a moist environment but you aren’t holding a backpack on one shoulder cause it will slide off every time. Overall, probably not the best choice for everyday wear but it will keep me warm through any weather tossed at me.
review.name: More Technical than Everyday Wear

review.reviewBody: This light down jacket with a wind and water proof shell is a great option for wet snowy day, or even a day when you are not sure what is coming.  The down is light weight, but the over-shell makes it warmer than you might guess.  It has quickly becoming my day-in day-out winter jacket. The double zipper front and pit zips make venting easy.  At 6’4” 185 lbs a large gives me a relaxed fit.  Two big “backpack friendly” pockets on the outside, two interior pockets, one zippered.
review.name: Weatherproof Down

review.reviewBody: The Storm Whisperer is the GOAT of winter weather jackets. The Pertex is soft, warm and extremely packable. The highlights are pockets in all the right places with the insulation being incredible warm for 33 degree rain/snow! It was dumping snow in Colorado and I walked out with just this and a T-shirt and was insanely warm and dry. The cuffs go over watches nice and smooth and the insulated hood is clutch. This is my go to everything jacket for everything this season. Thanks MH!
review.name: The GOAT

review.reviewBody: Super light, totally waterproof, premium construction, durable. Waterproof zippers look nice, and pocket placement works with a pack or harness. This jacket does it all, quiver killer. Lighter than a typical rain jacket without insulation. Hood goes over a climbing helmet… minimal adjustments just what you need but that’s what keeps it so light.  6’ 190 and a large is perfect.
review.name: Replace 3 jackets in your closet with one.

review.reviewBody: That other person literally can't type in their own address correctly and want to make it everyone elses problem... Crazy. I'm just here to give a good company a good review and level the playing field. I want people to buy this jacket first so I can know if I should haha.

name: Storm Whisperer Insulated Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: I have been eyeing this jacket for a long time and cannot wait to test it out this winter! Our PNW snow is wet and heavy and on occasion, my current HH gear hasn't been able to withstand the elements. I ordered the orange in my usual size small. For reference, I am 5' 5.5", 120 lbs, straight figure. Fits perfect other than the sleeves are a little long (and I do have long arms). I originally ordered a medium to compare and since I run cold, I wanted to be able to really layer up but in this case, the sleeves were uncomfortably long. I've already worn it as a rain coat, it's very versatile and looks great both on and off the mtn. The orange is highly visible so my fam can easily spot me. I also ordered the pants! Love love love both pieces and should have purchased sooner! I do wish more colors were an option.
review.name: Can't wait to wear it!

review.reviewBody: Love this jacket. Insulated perfectly not too much not too little. My only thing with this jacket is that it’s sleeves are very long which makes them bunch in my armpit but if you size down you’ll be fine. Overall great jacket and I tried so many
review.name: Love my jacket!

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket the end of last season as a treat to myself. It does in fact keep you very warm, however, the design of the jacket is rather lackluster. The zipper comes undone from the bottom on several ski days I’ve had, causing me to stop to open up and rezip my jacket. For how new and expensive it is, I’m kicking myself from not adding a bit more and going for a better quality jacket. Perhaps mine was defective, but I wouldn’t recommend this product.
review.name: Keeps you warm but poorly made

name: Lofoten GORE-TEX Insulated Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: I was really hoping this jacket would work for me. Unfortunately, the sleeves were ridiculously long on me. The rest of the jacket fit well and seemed proportional to what one would expect for an XS woman's jacket. I am confused as to why the sleeves come so long. I thought about keeping it, but it seems like this could be a really annoying aspect of the jacket. Will be returning. For reference, I am just under 5'3" and around 115 lbs - doesn't seem like I am expecting too much for an XS to fit properly.
review.name: Sleeves are Way too Long - Will be returning

review.reviewBody: Living in Vail Colorado this is my go to jacket for tooling around town in the winter.  When the polar vortex hit in January bringing subzero temps and 90mph winds I wore it skiing - and as promised I never felt cold!  Best purchase ever!
review.name: I have never felt cold wearing this jacket

review.reviewBody:
I bought this very expensive jacket for our harsh winters in Québec city. It is warm, very warm. I don't feel one bit of cold when I wear it. Wore it in -16 Celsius temperatures and I was toasty warm. So much that I came out of it very damp and uncomfortable. I'm an average woman who sweats very little so the issue is not on my end. 

I am outraged to have paid a fortune for a jacket that isn't breathing. Last Fjallraven product for me.

Oh and small detail, you can't detach the hood and it's very ackward for driving because it blocks your blind spot when you try to look sideways.
review.name: Non breathable lining

review.reviewBody:
I bought this jacket about a week ago and have really put it to the test. It has been below freezing every day since getting it and this week it dropped to -20F/-29C. With only a long sleeve shirt on (and some snow pants) I can comfortably walk around even in the -20F/-29C with the jacket zipped all the way up and hood on. Speaking of the hood, it is amazingly puffy and warm. I live in the northern Midwest (in the US) so there is a lot of wind and this jacket does an amazing job of stopping the wind, with gusts up to 60mph I haven't felt the wind cut through once.
I love how many pockets there are. The outside pockets are very warm and puffy. Even just wearing knit gloves in -20F/-29C I was able to put my hands in the pockets and they would warm back after about 5min. The pockets are VERY puffy though which does cut down a little on how much stuff you can hold in them (especially without them bulging out too much). I typically have my keys, chapstick, and light knit gloves in one pocket and my phone in the other and my hands still fit just fine, but I personally think the pockets could've been a tiny bit deeper to make up for the space lost to the puff.
This jacket is not particularly breathable, so if you are doing any moderate exercise, like uphill hiking or snow shoveling, you will get hot in it. For me at least, this jacket is a little too warm to wear while snow shoveling if it is above 20F without unzipping all the way, but great for just walking around the city or light trail walks with the dogs.
Overall, if you end up in weather that is consistently below freezing this jacket is definitely a great buy and I would highly recommend.

I bought a Medium and can comfortably fit a knit sweater or hoodie underneath. I could've fit into a Small but I wanted the extra space to layer and the small was snug.
I am 5'10'' (179cm), 158lbs
My measurements are: Chest 36.5in, Waist 29.5in, Hips 40.5in
The jacket length hits me at about crotch height/low butt and the sleeves are long enough to cover my hands when I ball my fists.
review.name: Amazingly Warm

review.reviewBody: I got this jacket last week and wasn't able to use it outside until today (and by that i mean it wasn't cold enough to really test it out). I went to the gym in a thin t shirt and i was so comfortable even though it was below freezing outside! This is the jacket I have been searching for. If you are on the fence, this jacket is worth it.
review.name: So worth it-i love this jacket so much

review.reviewBody: A high quality product, not disappointed at allá. Thanks you
review.name: Happy

review.reviewBody: When I received this coat as a present, I couldn't believe how thick and warm it was! It feels like wearing a warm sleeping bag. I like that the length isn't too long so I'm still able to move around while staying exceptionally warm. The wind protection is also great. I used it during a Boundary Waters winter trip in northern Minnesota dogsledding and skiing and have no complaints! Sizing is generous - I flex between M and L, went with M for this coat.
review.name: Warmest coat I have ever owned

review.reviewBody: I love the front pockets on this jacket, and the general level of insulation.  It has both snap buttons and a zipper, and I was able to zip it up all the way, so my face was half covered.  The red is a very pretty color, and I felt like a Swiss ski guide. My only gripe is that the zipper is difficult to line up at the bottom. I tried 4 or 5 times before I got the zipper fully in the slot.  If you're freezing, this will definitely lead to some cussing.
review.name: Mostly great

review.reviewBody: I love the jacket it is really warm.
review.name: I love it

review.reviewBody: I'm 5'9" and always wear a size medium in Fjallraven and most brands and this medium just wasn't flattering and the hood was huge even if wearing helmet. I'm in Montana and need a super warm jacket which this was but my husband said it looked too puffy and short. It just wasn't going to work with anything I wore, sent it back.
review.name: weird fit

name: Expedition Down Lite Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: This is my 2nd pair of Norrona capri-length shorts. The two-tone green is attractive and love all the pockets. Adjustable waist is a nice feature along with zip vents on the leg.  They are pricey but worth it. Great warranty as well.
review.name: Well made; great for hiking, biking

review.reviewBody:
I have these in grey and just bought the green/blue. As long as they arent completely filthy, they are my GO TO shorts. i am 5ft 4 and they fall below my knee when off saddle and when i am seated they are about at my knee cap, which i prefer. i HATE how most womens shorts are a little too narrow and not long enough. i end up with a gap between my knee pad and the short, aka the bits of thigh meat that stick out. the pockets are also useful, but i usually have my hip bag anyways. they are a good fit too, not manly or overly bulky. the quality is top notch and i have worn the crap out of these. i wash them on cold and hang dry. i have worn them so much that the elastic band has come lose on the inside waist of the pants, but it doesnt effect their wear-ability not does it effect me in any way. i just havent fixed it yet. 
i have worn these on a trip with 3 long/gross days in a row and i felt like a million bucks each day. pairs well with all the Norrona jerseys too! worth every penny full price, but even better when on super sale!
#norronaforlife
PS. Sorry for the dumb image. it was the most "normal" looking one i have showing the shorts.
review.name: PREMIUM MTB SHORTS

review.reviewBody: I really like the looks of these, and they are very comfortable. Took them to Alaska on our trip, was able to test out their waterproof rating. One day it poured on us in Alaska, but these shoes kept my feet nice and dry

review.reviewBody: After 6 months of wear, I am very pleased with the quality and durability of my Phil Mids. The waterproof membrane and leather keep my feet warm and dry in the snow and slush. review.reviewBody: These are terrific boots for mucking around town or up to the mountain in.  Fit is true to size but a little narrow so if you have wide feet these may not be the boots for you.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good fit, like the pocket placement. Kept me dry in moderate rain.
review.name: Great light jacket

review.reviewBody: Excellent as a wind breaker and kept me well dry during periods of light rain on a 10-day hike in northern Sweden. Well pleased with the purchase, especially as it was discounted.
review.name: Did vert well on long hike

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've been looking for a new, light rain jacket and finally found the perfect one. The hood fits my head perfectly, the armpit vents are functional, and I actually really like the front pockets located somewhere between the stomach and chest with the long slanted zippers.
review.name: Great, light rain jacket!

review.reviewBody: Everything you could want in a rain waterproof jacket.
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This jacket is perfect.  I love the simplicity of it, and it weighs nothing!
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the feel of the fabric.  Does an excellent job repelling water.
review.name: Great product!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great product. Excellent rain protection. Comfortable with ventilation. Absolutely great unique color!
review.name: Hiking Dry

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Have to try it out in rain but the jacket looks good though it runs slightly large to accommodate other layers underneath. Got it for a great price on sale. Marmot products are top-notch so expect this one to last as well. This supplements the 3-ply Marmot Gore-Tex Parka I bought over 2 decades ago which I use primarily for multi-day hikes. I plan to use this jacket for running on rainy days.
review.name: Good Value

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great fit, well constructed.  Haven't been in the rain yet, so we will see.
review.name: Great so far

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] What a great high quality jacket.  It is a great upgrade from the PreCip Eco that I already own.  Fits really well.

hasVariant.name: TL-BB13 Press Fit Bottom Bracket Removal Tool
hasVariant.description: Buy the Shimano TL-BB13 Press Fit Bottom Bracket Removal Tool online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: TL-BB13 Press Fit Bottom Bracket Removal Tool
review.reviewBody: The tool consists of a metal rod with a small rubber band and three small metal parts held around the metal rod with the rubber band. The rod goes through the bottom bracket and the three small metal part jam again the bottom bracket bearing. You then have to strike the metal  rod with some force with a mallet and eventually the bottom bracket pops out. When I did this the metal rod flew across the garage and when it struck the floor the rubber band and the three small metal parts separated from the rod and I lost vital parts. The tool is no longer usable. The tool needs to be redesigned in a more fool proof way - at least in my case.
review.name: Tool fell apart on first use.

name: TL-BB13 Press Fit Bottom Bracket Removal Tool

review.reviewBody: So cute and comfy and doesn’t slack on style. The material is very breathable so perfect during the summer I’d say.
review.name: Super comfy

review.reviewBody: Just got these and love them already. The fabric is light and soft, perfect for an easy hike, trip to the brewery or something to throw on after a long fall run. I got a size small. Everyone says to size up, which I suppose is true because in other kavu overalls I am an xs. I am 5’3 128 lbs. They fit loose, not tight around my hips or thighs and I have a trail runner thighs. Highly recommend!
review.name: My going out overalls

review.reviewBody: I love these. They’re great for traveling, hiking, or just vibes. Very comfy and stretchy, they also seem to be pretty stain resistant. On the slimmer side so if you want them looser I would size up. For reference, I’m 5’8” and 130lbs got a size Small and they fit snug.
review.name: Big overall girlie

review.reviewBody:
Wow. I wish I had known about these sooner. I live in overalls and jumpers. And the fabric for these is delicious. RUN! Go get ya some. Especially while they are nearly half off!
I don’t know about anyone else, but me? I have certain clothing items that are perfect, my favorites & this makes the cut. Fit, color, cut, price & feel (does it bring me joy😆) And Backcountry blew me away with their shipping. Holy cow it feels like I ordered it and the next time I opened my door there it was, talk about expedited shipping at no extra cost🤩. This is my first order, you will see this review on every item I purchased and I will be buying from
Backcountry again and again.
review.name: LOVE!

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my wife after she saw a friend wearing them. Fit is great and very flattering
review.name: Fits great

review.reviewBody: I wanted to love these, but unfortunately they run small for me in the hips and thighs
review.name: run small

review.reviewBody: Our daughter got these overalls last year and my wife kept borrowing them. Now she’s got her own. Great service and fast shipping.
review.name: My wife loves them

review.reviewBody: Love these overalls but disappointed in the fit! I’m a size 10, usually M or L. Ordered the L and they are so snug in the hips and thighs. :(
review.name: Not for curvy girls

review.reviewBody: I wear a pair of these overalls every day. They are my go to for everything . I have 3 pair from last year and 2 from this year. If you want a slimmer fit this years version is great. If you like a more relaxed fit order up.. I have size large and prefer the more relaxed fit of last years over this year. The new buckles are an upgrade, as well as the stiffer webbing. If the sizing had remained the same as previous years it would have been a 5 star review for sure.
review.name: Runners Smaller than 2023 version

review.reviewBody: I bought the dark succulent San Blas overalls last season and lived in them all summer. 5 stars to last seasons overalls! The fabric is lightweight, stretchy, quick drying, and cool enough to wear even in the summer. Last seasons overalls fit great! (ordered a Medium- I usually wear size 6-8 jeans/hips 40" waist 30"/length hits right above the ankle/made for a long torso), but these this new version fits about 1-2 inches smaller in the hips and thighs making it a bit more snug than I was expecting... I wish they had kept the same sizing year to year :/ I was so excited to see they just put out new designs and ordered one right away, but was disappointed with the change in sizing. I think the large might be too large if I were to order it, but medium is just a bit snug... keep this in mind when ordering. Maybe Kavu can put out more guidelines around fit in addition to the inseam measurements in the future.
review.name: The overalls you never know you needed

name: San Blas One-Piece - Women's

review.reviewBody: Hat made of lightweight, durable fabric, good sun protection with extra fabric cape at sides & back of neck. Sale price was very reasonable (with only 1 colour option, likely discontinued)
review.name: Great hat design, light fabric

review.reviewBody: Sun, rain, snow, hot, cold, this hat is it. Any job requiring ear protection…they fit over the hat and still hug the ear while offering protection from the elements. Comfortable, light weight…I buy them just to give to friends so they know the joy of this hat. Seriously! Ask my nephew…I gave him one.
review.name: Fist bump

review.reviewBody:
The hat is great for blocking sun, but it made me very hot on my run.  When I run in the shade I immediately remove the hat and feel the big temperature difference.
It was nice to soak the hat in water and then put it on.  Then it felt like I had a built in air conditioner.
review.name: Great for sun, but very hot

review.reviewBody: This has been my go-to hat for years.  I've worn it so much that the color has faded.  I really like how the skirt can be unbuttoned from the brim and let hang - it provides an additional ventilation option.  I also like the draw cord - again it allows ventilation options.  I've also found that the draw cord makes the hat easy to hang from my shoulder strap water bottle if I need to remove the hat while under trees for additional ventilation.  I wish it was still available in yellow.
review.name: Very versitile

review.reviewBody: Offers good sun protection and it is vey lightweight.
review.name: Great coverage

review.reviewBody: I purchased several similar hats from BackCountry because I am very fair-skinner and needed more protection from the sun.  This is my favorite of the three.  It's a light-weight fabric, easy to remove the back shield when I don't need it and it washes easily in the machine.  Very breathable.  Very happy with this purchase!!
review.name: Great fit and feel

review.reviewBody: This hat is terrific, but it didn't work for my husband for sailing. He needs lots of visibility, and while the flaps protect they also block peripheral vision. If your activity does not require a lot of that then go for it. The hat quality is very good, including the attachment of the flap, important. The size chart did not point us to the right size. While he needed it larger, he also needed it to be tighter to stay on in the wind. Sadly it just did not work.
review.name: Wished this worked out; watch the sizing

review.reviewBody: I wear this hat all the time for running and kayaking. It's light and drys well and fast. Will definitely get a second one as this hat has become indispensable to me as I spend a lot of time outdoors.
review.name: Great sun hat!

review.reviewBody: I have used this had for a few trips now, and it is much better than my older cowl hat. I particularly like that the cowl comes a bit further down and fully protects your neck. The other interesting thing I found is that it works quite effectively to keep bugs away from the back of your neck. I was able to use my bug net less.
review.name: This hat is much better than the old OR cowl hat

review.reviewBody: I bought the hat for a trip to SE Asia & Africa. The hat with the flap on does look a bit silly, but it comes off easily and is then just a nice baseball cap that's very comfortable and stays on well. I plan to use the flaps when faced with the worst of the heat, they seem to work better than anything else I've tried and pretty much anything effective looks a bit silly an
review.name: Highly recommend for sun protection

name: Sun Runner Cap

review.reviewBody: Nice build quality but the squeaky MIPS drives me nuts. Also there is no foam in front of your ears so you constantly get bugs trapped in there, not create if its a bee or wasp. Also this means cold ears/ice cream headache when its cold. Simple fix is to add some foam in there
review.name: MIPS squeaks, bugs get caught in ears

review.reviewBody: Crashed at a bike park and I'm convinced this helmet is the only reason my skull isn't cracked open. So thankful I was wearing this helmet. I've heard people say it's squeaky and it is if I purposely listen for it but I don't notice it at all while I'm riding.
I got this helmet a season ago and it’s still great. Very comfortable and cool colors. It’s nice that you can take out some of the padding for the uphills.
review.name: Good helmet

review.reviewBody: I took the worst crash of my career last week and the mainline worked flawlessly.
review.name: They work!

review.reviewBody: I like my mainline helmet. I cased a jump and landed on my head. I hurt in many places but not my head. Did its job well.
review.name: Helmet works!

review.reviewBody: I have been wearing one of these helmets for about a year. It is comfortable, well vented and light. After crashing at a bike park and landing face first on a rock I can also confidently say that it offers great protection also. I broke the helmet,but walked away with only a small cut on my face. I also bought the same helmet as a replacement. If you're considering buying a mainline, get one.
review.name: Highly recommend

review.reviewBody: Great product. Don’t normally bother writing reviews but just went over the bars and landed on what would have been my face if it hadn’t been for this helmet. Body pretty banged up but not a scratch on my face/head
review.name: Solid

review.reviewBody:
I ordered the Mainline MIPS after weeks of researching the right helmet, and decided on SMITH, due to its reputation and quality craftsmanship. And that’s apparently clear after receiving the product. However, it arrived with a torn box and small, but noticeable rub on the face guard. And it truly appears as if the item was resold after receiving it back as a return, which is disappointing, given that it’s my first SMITH experience, now dampened by this incident. It’s more a trust thing, than anything else: why sell an open box product as “new?” As well, why, knowing that I’m a first time buyer, would a company not want that experience to be the absolute best? 

Great MTB Helmet though! Extremely WELL MADE!!! Quality! Ruggedness, light on the head! Outstanding aeration…just can’t give it 5 stars due to what SMITH allowed for my first time dealing with them.
review.name: GREAT PRODUCTS…BUT!

review.reviewBody:
I might get some backlash here, but I may be the only one that hates this helmet. 

Pros:
-Lightweight
-Breathable
-assorted cheek pad sizes

Cons:
-No rear tension for a snugger fit
-Chin strap is impossible with gloves on *prefer a quicker release like the Bell Quick Air chin strap
-sizing is off, the med didnt feel secure on my dome and a small was too snug
-i cant pull up my goggles for a quick breather, they flop right back into your face

I wore this helmet once on a longer ride and was so ticked the whole time. I fumbled with my gloves every time i wanted to take it on and off for a breather. And i know its not just me because my friend has this helmet and its annoying with the chin strap and gloves. I didnt like how lose it felt, i had to have the chin strap basically choking me and even then i just didnt like the fit. 

If Smith adds a rear tension adjustor and an easier way chin strap i would love it. 

Just not for me. Lame.
review.name: Meh

review.reviewBody: Great fitting, great looking, confidence booster. I haven't taken a fall with the Mainline, but feel that it will keep me safe if that day comes.
review.name: I've owned Smith ski helmets, first Smith bike helmet.

name: Mainline Mips Full-Face Helmet

hasVariant.description: Buy the Easton EC90 SL Crank Arms online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Very light and quality finish but  the NDS crankarm developed significant play.   Pulled crankset and checked torque and everything at spec.  Will be going back to SRAM 1x
review.name: Super light but not durable

review.reviewBody: I installed this crankset, BB, and double chainring on my road bike to replace the prior generation EC90 model that experienced a spindle failure after 7+ years.  This version is much better built, with a far beefier spindle and nicer finish than the prior version.  After a dozen rides or so, my assessment is that these are quite stiff, smooth, and the understated graphics look great on a carbon frame.  I?ve been keeping my eye on the preload, which has not (yet) needed any adjustment or tweaking.  However, I forgot to keep my eye on the chainring bolts, and they all came lose after 100 miles or so.  Not a big issue, but my daily ride tools did not?until now?include a T30 wrench.  Only knock is that the proprietary spider and bolt config is making it difficult, if not impossible, to find (Lighter) chainring options for the 2x.  Overall, this is a great crankset and I?m very happy with the weight, stiffness, ring options, and graphics.  Highly recommend!
review.name: Terrific crankset!

name: EC90 SL Crank Arms

hasVariant.name: Dynama Jogger - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Dynama Jogger - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great for traveling. Look great, feel great. Good fit for people in the 5’ 2” range.
review.name: So versatile

review.reviewBody: Really happy with my purchase. I bought the medium size after reading the review stating they run big and they fit perfect. 140lbs 5ft2 ! Dont know yet if they durable but the feel light and super confy.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: Love the color and they are very comfortable.  I love the waist - smooth under tops.
review.name: Color and fit are great

review.reviewBody: Great pants for every casual outing from running errands to work, to hiking in the mountains.
review.name: Joggers

review.reviewBody: Such a great fit, very flattering, hope they bring them back!
review.name: Best. Joggers. Ever

review.reviewBody:
I just finished a few weeks of backpacking and loved these pants!! The waistband lays smooth and flat so nothing to dig in under a pack hipbelt. The material is light and breezy - comfortable for summer and provides mosquito protection but doesn't feel fragile. Look forward to using them bouldering too!  

Fit: I'd recommend sizing to the option that best fits your waist/hips since there is no drawstring adjustment. I am 5' 5' / 130lbs, Waist 29" Hips 37". I usually wear a size small but sized down to a xs and they fit me perfectly! 

Care: I would definitely recommend washing on cold and air-drying. I've shrunk past dynama pants in the dryer :/
review.name: All-time favorite backpacking pants!!

review.reviewBody: These pants have been great. I needed to stay out of the sun on a trip to Arizona and Utah after learning I had Lyme and needed to take a medication one needed to avoid the sun while on. They worked great with the exception of when you load the pockets,  your pants fall down. I used a hair tie to tighten the waist. I like what another person suggested was to put a hole in the pants and add your own draw string.
review.name: Great Features

review.reviewBody: Fits well, looks good- I have gotten lots of interest: who makes them, where can I get them? Rides low if you have something heavy in a pocket, otherwise really comfortable. Perfect length, cool enough or warm enough depending on a not too extreme temperature swing.
review.name: Just right.

review.reviewBody: I bought a pair in blue & I love them!  Immediately ordered 2 pair of the dynama high rise Bermuda shorts & love them, as well.  Please come out with a capri length in this line!
review.name: Great fit & super comfy

review.reviewBody: I recently got the Dynama Joggers in an xtra small but unfortunately the waist is way too big. I wish that there was a way to cinch the waist or even belt loops. Probably going to need to return these, very disappointed. I think if the waist wasn’t so large I would have loved these! For context I am 5’1 and 113-115 lbs.
review.name: Cannot adjust waist!

name: Dynama Jogger - Women's

Bought to test the idea of using my TD4 at Rule of 3 this year, turns out they work well as a gravel tire daily as well as on the trails around Northern Arkansas. 

Won’t be coming off soon, but they do ride a tiny bit slower than 38/42 gravel tires, obviously, but oh so fun.

review.reviewBody: Bought these for my Kona Sutra LTD gravel bike to have something smooth for bike paths and city riding but that would be a capable gravel and off-road tire. After ~ a year on these I'm super pleased with how they perform across various terrain. they're supple but speedy and have great grip... what else could you want?

review.reviewBody: Love the style + fit, but after storage, BUT my helmet had a very obvious stain where the goggles were placed on top of the helmet as well as on the side. Here's the strange thing: I have never stored the helmet with goggles on it (I store them separately and in a goggle bag) and I only used the provided Smith white helmet bag. Between the end of the ski season and now, a very clear imprint of my goggles/brand name has appeared across the front of the helmet well as additional other discoloration. None of the marks will come off so I'm at a loss as how this happened. I have put in a claim with Smith–fingers crossed they have a solution.
review.name: Discoloration issue with white helmet

review.reviewBody: Bought this as a gift for my girlfriend. Measured here head and got the medium MIPS. The fit was terrible, really bad pressure points on the top sides of the head for both of us. Couldn't go more than 5 minutes with it on before getting a headache, and this was on the loosest setting.
review.name: Terrible Fit

review.reviewBody: This helmet is warm, comfortable for a full day of skiing, ventable for sunny/hot afternoons, and stylish. I'm so happy with this helmet! Fits really well with the Squad goggles - no forehead gap which is my biggest pet peeve.
review.name: Perfect Helmet

review.reviewBody: I am part of the Smith Pro Program and have always loved Smith products! However, I bought this helmet last ski season brand new, stored it in the provided Smith helmet drawstring bag, and opened it up this ski season only to find a ton of dark black and brown discoloration all over the helmet from the Smith helmet bag. I am very disappointed, since it has had minimal use and already looks dirty and defective!
review.name: Major discoloration after storage in the provided Smith Helmet bag

name: Liberty Mips Helmet - Women's

review.reviewBody: This board is everything you want in a resort slaying snowboard. Directional twin with a fun shape and a playful flex. Feels like a twin in the park, however the nose and tail shape combined with the 3BT make it surprisingly confident in deep snow too.  I also set my bindings back a little to give it even more nose for those deeper days. This board really can do everything... It's perfect!!

review.reviewBody: The fabric feels great. The zipper hand pockets r great. The pocket on the right leg is positioned very badly that whatever u put in it can get pinched by ur knee which is not comfortable. Im 5-10 i tried size M. There r no vents on the back of the knees.
review.name: Vents

review.reviewBody:
These pants have been an excellent addition to my outdoor gear. I use them for a wide range of activities, including climbing, mountaineering, and hiking, and they perform consistently well. They keep me warm, block wind effectively, and do a great job repelling moisture, making them ideal for various conditions.

These pants are versatile, comfortable, and allow for great mobility, which is essential for the activities I do. My only critique is with durability. I noticed some wear starting to develop in the crotch area after only a few times wearing them. While this hasn’t impacted overall performance yet, it’s disappointing to see wear develop so quickly. I'm still hopeful they will last a fair amount of use.

Despite this, the Cirque Lite Pants remain a favorite for their performance and versatility, and I would still recommend them to anyone looking for reliable softshell pants for demanding outdoor adventures!
review.name: Versatile, Functional, Comfortable

review.reviewBody: Love the pants, but would much rather prefer traditional belt loops. Or at least the ability to tighten down the belt without it going off to one side. It's quite annoying.
review.name: Subpar belt

review.reviewBody: I bought these pants for ski touring, mountaineering, and backpacking and I have been nothing but impressed. The material is strong but still breathable and it repels water well. On a recent trip to Peru they kept me warm but also cool during the day. I am very impressed by how well these pants maintain a good temperature. This has quickly become one of my favorite pairs of pants. I am 5’11” 150lbs and a medium fits me great.
review.name: Expedition Ready Pants

review.reviewBody: They got redesigned and pockets are smaller now where I can't use pants pockets with gloves like last pair of cirque lite pants.
review.name: redesigned pockets are alot smaller.

review.reviewBody:
I have used these pants for exploring outdoors, winter activities, travelling and casual wear. When others wear sublayers or avoid going out, I can wear these at -30C (-22F), light rain, windy conditions, or in rough unexplored trails/forests. I have also used it to travel in Europe and wore it in restaurants or going out. I however avoid wearing it in high temperatures (more than 35C / 95F), heavy downpours or when I will be in long direct contact with the snow. They are also not comfortable when chilling, you will prefer lighter and stretchier pants. 

These pants will give you the confidence to go anywhere, either summiting peaks, going offgrid or just having fun with the kids in the snow. The value is amazing. 

They are not forever pants though - its only defect is that it piles heavily in the back, around the sitting area. Not sure what is the cause, if it is the fabric or other. It cannot be the washing or drying method since it does not pile elsewhere. I will still wear it for a couple of months but the piling up issue does not give me confidence to replace it with another Cirque pants
review.name: Great pants with a flaw, piling in the back

review.reviewBody: I bought these pants less than two weeks ago and have worn them for a total of 6 days in the mountains climbing snow and easy rock. After the first day the fabric under my harness legs was pilling. Now the entire front of the pants and seat are heavily pilled up. In comparison, my 3 year old Cirque Lite pants have seen 100s of field days and show less wear. The cuff zipper also doesn't stay zipped when using bungee to keep the cuffs over boots and this allows snow up in the cuff and in boots.
review.name: Fit well, not durable

review.reviewBody: These pants are very comfortable, have lots of stretch for mountain scrambling and hiking, breathe well, and look good. Unfortunately the material doesn't seem very durable as it's already pilling along the pockets and seat. I have 8-year-old similar pants from a competing brand that are better in those respects. These could be great so hopefully they'll improve them in the next design phase but I would not recommend purchasing these now if you plan to use them for a long time like I do with my apparel.
review.name: Comfortable mountain pants with durability issues

review.reviewBody: This is a good all-round hiking and travel pants but the cuff feel too heavy. The built-in belt is a nice update over the previous version. The imprint pattern on the lower leg make the pants hang heavy, and it cannot be cinched up tighter, for example, to keep our ticks. I would buy the previous version if it were to come back but it is unlikely that I will buy more of this version.
review.name: The built-in belt is a nice update but I don't like the cuff

review.reviewBody: Just what I need for warmer days out touring. Nice and stretchy, not too warm, and they fit over my boots.
review.name: Perfect Spring Touring Pants

name: Cirque Lite Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: The adaptors do not work with studs, their is no way to make anything beside the frame attach points work, which the visualization and insturctions did not make clear, their were references about adaptors: it was only after opening everything up and looking at what I had I realized it would not work: what a waste of time and money to discover this, otherwise it looks like a nice setup, I am just going to use a seatpost rack that I can take on and off quick

review.reviewBody: Have used the rack for the past month.  Pairs nicely with Orlieb rollerboard panniers.  Easy to install and remove.  Using the rack for weekday commuting and quick and easy to remove when not needed on weekend rides.  Holds panniers securely!
review.name: Awesome rack for commuting/weekend rides

review.reviewBody: Backcountry and Ortlieb both did a great job on this. Everything was included, even extra pieces in case I had different fittings on my bike. And although included instructions would have been enough, they even provided a link with a video that made it so easy to put on my bike! Love it!
review.name: Just as described

review.reviewBody: This is a great rack. the installation was easy and straight forward. It attaches to your bike in about 10 seconds and comes off in about the same amount of time. So, essentially it's there when you need/want it and gone when you don't. Although it can be used with Quick release thru axles its a bit of a pain so I just put in a solid thru axle
review.name: Great rack. Easy on/off

review.reviewBody: I was able to set it up quickly and it is super easy to take on and off the bike as needed. I also like that it is easily adjustable between bikes.
review.name: Great features

review.reviewBody:
This is THE best jack-of-all-trades, high performance climbing shoe that I have ever owned. If I had to chose only 1 climbing shoe to use for the rest of my life, it would be this shoe. It is great at edging, cracks, steep terrain, slab. Although other shoes may be better at each of these disciplines individually, this shoe does it all with incredible performance.
If I am going somewhere new and don't know what to expect with the footwork, this shoe is always in my bag. From Hard sport, to multipitch trad, this shoe does it all, and has been since the 90's.
review.name: The best all-around high performance shoe around

review.reviewBody: I’ve been relying on these for 15 years (nothing is as solid for edging and generally keeping my feet happy). Contrary to some of the other reviews, I think the new ones are  the same great shoe.
review.name: Good old miura

review.reviewBody: I've been climbing in the Miuras since the early 2000s and have loved the shoes over the years. Recently my old pair needed to be resoled, so while they were off at the shop getting new rubber I ordered a pair of the new models. I wanted a size just a little larger for all day comfort so I ordered 46 (normally I order 45.5). When I got them they are smaller than the 45.5 that I had off being resoled. I'm not sure why they changed the sizing and the unfortunate part is that 46 is the largest size they have, so I can't order the next size up.....
review.name: Sizing Changed

review.reviewBody:
I bought this pair of shoes 3 months ago and I am a weekend climber. These shoes are pretty good overall but not durable at all. Within 3 months the rubber on my toe has been massively scratched. The last Miura pair which I had couldn't resist more than one year.
I reckon the price is too high by taking into account the durability.
review.name: Good climbing shoes overall but not durable

review.reviewBody: Not a big fan of the new version of these. They used to be probably the best all around shoe on the market. Now they're closer to an aggressive bouldering shoe. The sizes are different from the old version too, they're sized down smaller now. I went w/ my normal size 42 and ended up having to get them soaking wet every time i used them just to get them on my feet, well after the break in period. In conclusion, you're better off going w/ the katanas. Don't waste your money unless you've tried them and know for a fact they're what you want.
review.name: Older model was better
comment: In my experience these are identical to the previous version except for the color change. Might be worth another shot? maybe you got a defective pair?

review.reviewBody: My third pair over a twenty year period.  I’ve tried others in between, but always come back to Miuras.  I hope you never stop making them as long as my old body is still able to pull on stone
review.name: Miura

review.reviewBody: They keep getting better. A solid shoe. Love it for climbing granite and limestone. Excells on steep edges.
review.name: Fits great, durable and precise.

review.reviewBody: I have been climbing in the Miura since it first came out many many moons ago. It WAS the Smith Rock shoe. It has since turned into the shoe I use the most for difficult multi-pitch routes. Classics like the Naked Edge in Eldorado Canyon are perfect for the Miura. Or is the Miura is perfect for the Naked Edge:) When the new design was rumored to be coming out I was a bit worried that it would change. There are some slight changes which are mostly cosmetic but the new heel rand and fit are better for me now. I have a narrowish type foot and low heal volume so that was very welcomed. I can't imagine this shoe leaving my quiver anytime soon! Thanks Sportiva!
review.name: The venerable Miura!

name: Miura Lace Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody: Nice liner gloves. Heavy weight. Feel like they might last for a while. They are sort of bulky to fit into other gloves, but work great as a liner in mitts and overmits. Perfect combination for me.
review.name: Nice Liner gloves

review.reviewBody: I wear these as my go to glove for walking around the city in the winter. I keep a pair in all of my jackets and I also use them for running on colder days.
review.name: Versatile and cozy

review.reviewBody:
These gloves are exactly what I was looking for. Warm and not bulky.
Not sure about the touchpad usefulness, I haven't had much luck with that feature.
review.name: Warn and comfortable

review.reviewBody: These gloves are great for those times you want to get your hands out of the weather but need some dexterity. They are great for driving or just snapping a photo. They are just right for those in-between seasons as well
review.name: Comfortable and warm

review.reviewBody: I bought these at the end of March last year after freezing my hands of on the AT. Finally tried them out this morning on a chilly hike on a local trail. It was 31 degrees when we started and my finger's quickly got cold to the point of hurting. I have the lightweight version so I thought the heavyweight version would work better. It didn't. These were awful. Very disappointing. Plus the sensor which should work with your cell phone doesn't work.
review.name: Cold Fingers

review.reviewBody: These gloves are perfect for dry, cold, aerobic activities. I have taken them out while on walks and trail runs in light snow and cold days. They breathe well, and are sufficiently warm for their light weight. I would size down 1 size if I purchased again but love them otherwise.
review.name: Mens Vigor Gloves

review.reviewBody: Great gloves, fit well, touch sensors work well - this was one of the big reasons for ordering them
review.name: Fits like a ...

review.reviewBody: Gloves were thinner than I expected. Not sure where the heavyweight comes in. And I had to alter the thumbs on a pair of XL's. They were at least a ½" longer than needed.
review.name: Good but not great.

review.reviewBody: The gloves are good and I am able to use then with my phone, but they aren't as warm as I had wanted. They are good when it's in the 40's, but not enough when it is below freezing.
review.name: Not as warm as I hoped

review.reviewBody: Fall apart real fast.  They look great.  Only buy these if you plan on walking around town with them.  Anything more and they won't hold up longer than a month
review.name: Great looking glove but cheaply made

review.reviewBody: The Range Torque Wrench is a happy blend of lightweight, capability, and quality. It has already come in handy several times over the past couple months and I expect it will continue to serve well. The clicks are positive and the bits are well made. The case keeps everything together very well. It is pair with a 1/4'' breaker bar from Amazon and a magnetic 1/4'' hex holder which allows me to crack bolts loose without damaging the wrench. This will accompany me on all my adventures.

description: Buy the Badfish Flyweight Inflatable Stand-Up Paddleboard Package online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Flyweight Inflatable Stand-Up Paddleboard Package
hasVariant.description: Buy the Badfish Flyweight Inflatable Stand-Up Paddleboard Package online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
If you enjoy travelling with toys but try to keep the weight to a minimum, then I can't imagine a better inflatable SUP to accompany you on your adventures.  I took the Flyweight to Costa Rica for 3 weeks and did absolutely everything with it.  Paddling small rivers through mangroves to the sea, enjoying daily cruises within the bays and to offshore islands, exploring reefs and their awesome eco-systems at low tide, a little surfing, and even a four day self supported trip down the Nicoya coastline.   The Flyweight is the ultimate travel companion and handled everything with stability and ease well beyond its weight or size.  While not necessarily intended for the open ocean that stability was a welcome surprise when the winds picked up and created a little more chop than I'd hoped for.  

Along with the performance of the board, its lightweight construction allows for easy carrying - 15 minute walks to and from la playa daily (and sometimes more than once) were a piece of cake.  The paddled carry handle is on point.  Packing & checking the board, pump and all of my personal effects into one bag was a bonus as well - AND NO EXTRA FEES AT THE AIRPORT :)

If you enjoy travelling I can't imagine a more capable board to bring with you for all types of endeavors.  As much as it opened up new doors abroad I can't wait to get home to Colorado and see where the next adventure in the backyard awaits.  Badfish SUP is truly Shaping Adventure with the Flyweight.
review.name: Adventure Travel Ready

review.reviewBody: The Flyweight is so light, easy to roll up, and so easy to travel with. Since it is only 18 pounds I was able to fit everything I needed for my trip into the board bag, which saved me on the fees of checking more than one bag. Despite its light weight, it is still very rigid and durable. I love the water bottle holder! I would highly recommend this board for anyone who is looking for a good all-arounder.
review.name: My go-to board!

review.reviewBody: This thing is so light but still paddles as well as any board I have used. The material is very easy roll so you can get it into a smaller bag for travel and its easy to haul around. I have used it for paddling flat water and also for surfing small waves on vacation. The quality is very good, durable and I like having three removable fins.
review.name: Ultimate Travel Board

name: Flyweight Inflatable Stand-Up Paddleboard Package
