review.reviewBody: These wheels make all the difference! They work well even in a couple of inches of snow which is awesome for living up north. Easy to attach to the trailer. I wish there was a thicker option for the jogging wheel as well so I could more easily stroll too!
review.name: Favorite accessory

review.reviewBody: Love them, should have started with these Monster truck wheels first
review.name: Love them, should have started

review.reviewBody: Love these wheels. We put them on our burley bee and they have really improved the ride for our one-year-old. He is a lot more comfortable now than he was with the standard wheels.
review.name: Love these wheels. We put

review.reviewBody: They are great I can go on and off road towing my 80 lbs. 🐕
review.name: They are great I can

review.reviewBody: These make a huge difference transporting an unloaded trailer. I no longer feel like I'm pulling a buckboard wagon over cobblestone roads. When I load the trailer I sometimes forget I'm hauling anything at all. If your budget allow and life partner allow it, buy these for any Burley you have.
review.name: These make a huge difference

review.reviewBody: These tires are much more suitable for day to day riding. We got good life out of the original tires but I feel much better pulling our little one with these.
review.name: Quality Upgrade

review.reviewBody: I wish that I had the option to buy the trailer with the larger tires and not have to buy it with the "street" wheels and tires and them replace them with the larger "trial and sand" tires.
review.name: 3 inch tires for bike trailer.

review.reviewBody: I never used the stock tires but my bike is a fat tire Ebike so I wanted the trailer to match. We do a lot of off road and sand riding so I figured the fat tires would move along and sink in less than the stock tires. So far they have been great!
review.name: Great tires!

review.reviewBody: Recommend the 16" wheels as the primary Burley wheels. The Burley Nomad with the addition of the wheel kit makes any bike into a great all purpose cargo bike. It is especially useful for e-bikes which are now my primary bikes.
review.name: Recommend the 16" wheels as

review.reviewBody: Great Jacket. I prefer a jacket with a little room in the shoulders.  This is perfect.  Room for a medium weight down jacket.
review.name: Great high end jacket

review.reviewBody: Very good quality jacket! Use it under heavy rain and not wet at all.it’s by far the best jacket I own, for hike, touring or just a day in town, i got the black that’s make him universal. Im a tall 6pi and slim 140lbs women and i took the size small in men. The size is perfect the sleeves are long enough (which is very rare for me). I highly recommend this jacket. Got him from an warranty claim, OR have the best warranty products. So just positive comments on my side.
review.name: Oui oui oui

review.reviewBody: Great coat! Flexible, waterproof and good looking!
review.name: Great coat

review.reviewBody: For the price of this jacket I would have expected a slightly thicker shell, and a few more features like thumb gaiters, and a powder skirt. Fit is a little intersting, based on reviews I went for the large, arms are longer while the waist is tighter combined with the length its a little odd. I am typically a large in everything I have plenty of OR jackets and am a large but I wish i went with an XL in this.
review.name: for the price I would have expected some better features

review.reviewBody: I bought this as a general rain shell.  The C-knit material has a nice feel to it and moves well with the body.  My only concern is the water proofness of the stretch GT panels.  The specs say it has the same water proof rating as the main shell, so we shall see.  I've only been in light showers so far.  I figure it's warranted by OR and GT. I love the two-way front zip and the side vent zips work well. Pleased with purchase.
review.name: Impressed so far

review.reviewBody: Lightweight, great fit, stretchy in all the places you want it to be. Extremely waterproof, good pockets/storage, very happy with this item. Infinity Guarantee from OR is NO JOKE, love this brand.
review.name: Superb Shell

review.reviewBody: I am super stoked with the performance, comfort and looks of this jacket! It does well in the PNW with the heavy, wet snow conditions we have often. This shell protects you from the cold wind but is still comfortable on the spring skiing days! I've done some hikes with my OR grid fleece on underneath the Hemispheres || and together they breathe well and prevent moisture buildup inside. I've used OR products for many different purposes. Such as their gloves while serving in marine corps infantry, grid fleece tops while BASE jumping/skydiving and ski gear in the PNW. I've always been impressed with their design and durability. Thanks for making great gear OR!
review.name: They nailed it with this jacket!

review.reviewBody: This Jacket is great so far. The only thing I would add is another chest pocket on the outside and inside. My old Jacket had this and I loved it. The side vent zips don't go into the armpit. The zipper isn't a waterproof one but does seem very low profile. Hoping it holds out the water like a water proof one would. Great Jacket so far with 10 skis days on it.
review.name: Great so Far

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable. I can wear a sweater and vest and still easily zip up the Men's Hemisphere jacket. The hood provides excellent coverage.
review.name: Man, I Love This Jacket

review.reviewBody: I've taken this on around 10 days skiing (with a few being backcountry) and have not had it miss a beat. Very breathable for the level of weatherproofing it affords. I've been in the pouring rain, dumping snow, and it hasn't let me down! Lots of nice features you would expect in a higher price bracket
review.name: Breathable, durable, and waterproof

name: Hemispheres II Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: Warm, light, very nicely styled, lovely soft fabric and lovely colours. Great size and positioning of the front chest pocket. Perfectly functional zips. A great wrap around to keep the core warm and can be used under any other layer if needed. Love it.
review.name: Warm, light, very nicely styled,

review.reviewBody: This is probably the most versatile item of kit I own. It is incredibly warm without adding bulk, very lightweight for the hills and packs down well in my rucksack when not being worn. Always goes in my swim bag for helping maintain my core temperature after an open water swim, it's the best thing I've found for this. Really happy with it and wouldn't be without it on the hills now.
review.name: One of my favourites

review.reviewBody: So versatile all year round, a must have for any layering system. Excellent for a light windproof on chillier hill tops in the summer or as an extra layer of warmth in the winter.
review.name: Versatile layering must have.

review.reviewBody: A lovely vest, keeps me warm whilst walking and even in the caves !!
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody: Great fit, perfect for spring into summer as a flexible extra layer in combo with with a range of other layers.
review.name: Great fit, perfect for spring

review.reviewBody: The Xenair Vest bust fit is too snug. It should be perfect, and fits a gap in the market - light, warm, packable. I'm a 14/16 and not 'big busted'. I have both a 16 RAB Microlight Jacket and a 14 RAB Gilet. The Xenair size14 fits is uncomfortably snug across the bust. The size 16 Xenair is a good bust fit, but shapeless and baggy everywhere else. Fix the fit and I'll buy it!
review.name: Should be great but sadly doesn't fit right

review.reviewBody: Light, packable vest that keeps you warm. Easy to wear as a midlayer and allows the flexibility to wear a jacket over the top without being bulky. Isn't as fitted as a microlight vest which does add extra comfort around the hip area for myself.
review.name: Light, packable vest that keeps

review.reviewBody: does the trick, keeps me dryer than i would be without it! Still a bit of splash on the ankles with proper installation
review.name: works well!

review.reviewBody: Thought about installing full fenders on my gravel bike, but the whole installation process looks aggravating to say the least. So, I purchased one of these and couldn’t be happier. It’s simple and effective. Haven’t taken it out on any gnar, but it works well under normal commuting conditions. So, give the bum side of your kit a break and give the Origami a try.
review.name: An effective alternative

review.reviewBody: Yeah - we know this isn't like having a full fender, fellow reviewers. This is a super cheap, easily installed piece of plastic that can make all the difference on a ride. Keeps anything above it dry - whether that be your bum, your saddle bag or your buddy's face. If you are doing group rides on wet roads, don't be a jerk - buy this simple, cheap thing and use it. Everyone will thank you. I use it on the gravel bike, which has a round seat tube, and on the Giant TCR, which has a tear-drop shaped seat tube; no issues installing on either.
review.name: Simple & effective

name: Origami Fender

review.reviewBody: I love this cutting board ,, nice lightweight,, easy to add inside my backpack
review.name: I love this cutting board

review.reviewBody: This is the perfect size for the field camp kitchen. Opens enough for you to cut or chop, and then put in the pot. Folds up nice and small.
review.name: Perfect size for the field

review.reviewBody: This lil Cutting board is Great for Camping and Tailgating!! I've been taking it to the Ski Areas to us at my Truck-Logde since most lodges are closed this season for Covid. Compact but perfect for trail!!
review.name: Great for the Truck Lodge!

review.reviewBody: Overpriced for a cutting board that doesn't stay flat when using. I recommend dollar tree plastic cutting mats for camping.
review.name: I want to return

review.reviewBody:
I have the small version of this board which is thinner (lighter), but almost so small I cant cut my normal stuff on it, which is why I got this one, but its so thick and heavy, it has a really hard time staying open, when I put it down, it bows up rather than laying flat. the food im cutting is so light it doesnt hold it down so I have to hold it, which makes me go back to the other one and just have stuff hanging off the side. 

It's a good board, but that one thing is so annoying I really wouldn't recommend it sadly.
review.name: Its great, but not perfect

review.reviewBody: I'm prepping for a backcountry snowshoe trip and just wanted to expand my camo kitchen a little more, so I figured i needed to add-in a cutting board! I'll update on the use of it once I complete my trip!
review.name: Expanding the Camp Kitchen

review.reviewBody: Small, lightweight and durable. I've cut meat and veggies both on it and used it as a lap table.
review.name: I would buy again.

review.reviewBody: I have this one for many years. Good quality, wont tear under your knife. Easy to clean, you can put it in your Day pack for the lunch without feeling it. Lightweight is a sure thing. The only cons. I see is the small size when you base camping.
review.name: Efficient!

review.reviewBody: I use this all the time cooking at base camp. It's flat enough to slide anywhere in your pack and so light you don't notice!
review.name: extremely handy!

review.reviewBody: After years of slicing tomatoes with my leatherman, I finally caved and bought a proper chef's knife for the trail. I don't know why it took me this long- I love this knife! It's light, has a blade protector so you can just toss it in with the rest of your mess kit, and it's super sharp. Can't go wrong really for under 20 bux.
review.name: Better than my chef's knife at home

name: Alpine Deluxe Cutting Board

review.reviewBody:
I thought these shorts were so cute but a previous review scared me. Do not be afraid!

I wear a size 8 - 10. I usually buy a medium in elastic waist shorts. I sized up to a large and they fit perfectly. I'm not sure why it was stated that they ran ridiculously small. Size up - but I think that's all you need.

I love the print. I love the material. I love that the back is longer than the front. The only thing I don't like is that they are low-rise in the waist. I am definitely a fan of the high-rise. If you have a belly these are not the shorts for you.
review.name: Not Bad At All

review.reviewBody: Although not "tested" yet, these ski pants look as if they will perform well. Great stitching, qualtiy material, good fit with room for winter undergarments. Adjustable waist.
review.name: Nice Weight and Feel

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Lightweight great zipper quality true fit size plenty warm during the winter but light enough for spring
review.name: Thermagraph Pant

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Unfortunately these pants aren't available in XS but aside from that, the quality and insulation is amazing.
review.name: Amazing quality and very warm

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’m a bigger guy 6’3” 225lbs with an athletic build i.e. broad shoulders, smaller waist, flatter stomach, and long arms. I tried the L jacket and L pant on and it fit fine but was a little snug (pants especially snug around my waist) so opted for the XL jacket and XL pant. The XL fit is great, the cut is great, and there’s no unnecessary bulk to weigh you down. 

I’m a sucker for well engineered…anything. So when it comes to the feature set (which is phenomenal), overall quality, and a dang good fit I have to say you’re just not going many if any better set ups for the versatility that this offers. 

Now I haven't had many chances to run this gear through all of its paces in various weather conditions besides 20°- 33°F snow / light rain but so far I’m impressed and I think I’ll continue to be impressed.
review.name: It’s Impressive

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] They don’t quite sit on my hips as well as my old 686 pants
review.name: They don’t quite sit on

review.reviewBody:
Good quality with cargo pocket on leg.
It has some thermal pads on knees and bud making you warm even sitting on snow.
Super good waterproof, I'm a hard core snowboarder, riding a whole day 8 hours, it never wet. It also has thermal zip you can open it and let wind get through or close it to keep warm. Super good pants.
review.name: Good quality with cargo pocket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great snow pants. Ordered Medium. Fits well. I'm 6', 165lbs. Like the insulation. Good movement in pants. It has all right pockets that I desire and are waterproof.
review.name: Great snow pants. Ordered Medium.

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of these snow pants. The first pair lasted 3 seasons. I work in the ski industry so I am pretty hard on my gear, but when it came time to replace, I went back for more. The most important feature to me is the level of waterproofing, which is great for those wet days on the lift. The insulation on the seat of the pants is really nice and I like the vents on the inside because it keeps snow from getting into the pant. There are a lot of pockets and I like that they are zippered. The color on the knees faded after a few seasons, but I do a lot of kneeling, so it is too be expected. Overall, I would recommend these snow pants
review.name: Waterproof with lots of features

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Pants are high quality. The BOA function is very helpful to adjust shoes on the fly. They run a little on the larger side, but that might be a 'me' thing. Great pants!
review.name: Great pants!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great fit and feel. This my second pair of 686 insulated ski pants. The fit is better than the 3 in 1 cargo insulated ski pants
review.name: Great fit and feel. This

name: Quantum Thermagraph Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: Bought this about three weeks ago. Very warm and comfortable, but it leaks a fair number of feathers and I find I really can’t wear it over dark clothes.  Otherwise no complaints at all.
review.name: Great but leaks feathers

review.reviewBody: This jacket is really well made, has vivid and handsome colors true to the photos, and is every bit as warm as advertised. I can't imagine ever wearing more than a light base layer underneath this for any temperature above 15F. It pains me to say I'll be sending this back, because the fit through the waist is just too slim for me. I zip it without issue and can rotate freely, but it's just too "on" for my taste, which speaks only to my preferences, not the garment. For reference, I'm currently 5'10", 190 lbs, with a 33" waist, size L in most shirts, sweaters, and jackets. Yes, I'd like to drop a dime, and will by spring, but I'm 55 years old and odds are I'll dwell somewhere close to this silhouette the rest of my days. Dangit! Might just try the XL, but I'd likely pay for the middle expansion with floppy sleeves. "What a drag it is getting old."
review.name: Great in every way, but too slim for me.

review.reviewBody: This jacket looks great on you and the colors are some of the most interesting available in insulated jackets.  The coat is athletic fit,  not regular as the specs say.  The coat is warm for its extremely light weight and has large, adequate pockets and a snug hood.  This jacket is one of the few that I paid full price for from the manufacturer, I liked the green color so much.  It reminds me a bit of a lighter-weight version of Feathered Friends? (Seattle) Eos jacket, which has the best warmth to weight ratio of any coat.   Recommended.
review.name: nice jacket

review.reviewBody: all fits perfectly with this jacket, extremely warm in cold weather, tried in a -1c temperature with just a t-shirt under, and the warmth was just shoking, dits true to size, extremely recommended.
review.name: Epic Jacket

review.reviewBody: Throw this on and it feels like you're wrapped in a puffy cloud. While I have the Large, which is great for throwing over the shell, I would definitely get a medium for proper laying under the shell. The Indigo Night/Lemon Chrome looks great as well. Haven't put this through the wringer yet, but have worn it quite a few times on cool mornings, and it keeps me plenty warm. Soft, warm, (feels) durable, and should be great for the upcoming winter.
review.name: Feels like you're wrapped in a cloud

review.reviewBody: Warm, but not hot, athletic fitting, lighter than light. My spouse loved hers with equal force. Buy this coat!
review.name: Best Down Coat Ever

name: Lyngen Down850 Hooded Jacket - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Whakata Puffy Low x Skida Shoe
review.reviewBody: I really loved the look of these shoes and the large toe box. However, I found that they have a huge design flaw around the heel and ankle where the waterproof flap is sewn around the opening of the shoe. There is a very thick seam that runs right across the heel where the flap is sewn onto the shoe that is horribly uncomfortable. I am not sure who would think that putting a large seam across the heel would be comfortable. Perhaps ordering a size up is the answer? I don’t know. But I was really disappointed for the price if these shoes. Returned. Oh, and receiving notice from Backcountry as to whether they received my return seems to be a crap shoot. I don’t think I will be ordering from this retailer again.
review.name: High hopes but poor design

review.itemreviewed: Whakata Puffy Low x Skida Shoe
review.reviewBody: If you are looking for sleekness, these are not it - but they are super comfy, insulated so they are warm, and the print makes them irresistible!  The collab between Oboz and Skida is a winner!  Perfect for wearing to the resort as well as apres.  The fit is wide, but it works with my ski socks.  I got a size 7 elsewhere because they looked big to me, and they were too small, so ordered the size 8 on Backcountry.  They fit perfectly lengthwise, but as stated, are a wider fit.  I will use these every time I head to the resort to ski.
review.name: Cute and Practical!

name: Whakata Puffy Low x Skida Shoe

review.reviewBody: I was very hesitant to purchase this seat- the reviews were what convinced me. It's the same size and shape as the seat that came with my Specialized 5.0 and that was a HUGE concern for me. However, after getting the seat and riding over 100 miles on it- there is NO comparison. I don't know how they did it, but they crammed a very nice, comfortable seat into this small package. I'm 6' tall and weigh 215 for reference. And I LOVE this seat. Knowing what I do now- I'd have paid even more for it.
review.name: My sit bones love it!!

review.reviewBody: Shipment by FedEx showed delivery to a house in the same neighborhood, but different street number, batched with a bunch of BAXTER packages destined for another customer, another house. By seeing the house number we could eventually find that house and our package. Very scary to see that a delivery had been made, and no pkg arrived at our own house. What sub-par irresponsible package grouping to delivery our package along with a bunch destined for another house, another address, and think you are meeting customer needs. Very thankful we could figure this out same day and grab our package before it got returned or stolen by the recipient address people!
review.name: Product OK but Shipment was VERY sub-par

review.reviewBody: I read the hype, and was skeptical. Then I tried it. Totally different than all my previous saddles. I've had Fizik, Bontrager and Selle. All high end road bike saddles. All were good. None as good as this Specialized. I've put over 200 miles on it so far.
review.name: Best Bike Saddle EVER

review.reviewBody: Does it work, is it more comfortable? Yes, it is! The secret to this saddle's comfort is that it eliminates pressure points that make other saddles uncomfortable after 2-3 hours riding and riding multiple days. Is it worth the cost? Skip the carbon rails and go for the cheaper, but not cheap, pro version with titanium rails. That's the route I went and yes it is worth every penny.
review.name: Most Comfortable

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable on tarmac and gravel, I stay firmly in position on the saddle - no slipping and sliding which has been an issue on some of my previous saddles - and the honey comb top seems to stay clean enough despite all the nooks and crannies. So good I have one on both of my bikes.
review.name: Fantastic!

name: Power Pro with Mirror Saddle
